meanings.definition: The sloping edge or face on a cutting tool.
meanings.sent1: The bezels of the knife help in making precise cuts.
meanings.sent2: The sharp bezels of the chisel are used for carving wood.
meanings.sent3: Tom accidentally touched the bezels of the blade and cut his finger.
meanings.sent4: Her precision with the bezels of the scissors was like that of a skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming bezels of the scalpel reflected the bright light in the operating room.

meanings.definition: A groove or flange that holds a gemstone in place.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler carefully set the diamond in the bezels of the ring.
meanings.sent2: The necklace's bezels securely held the precious gemstones in place.
meanings.sent3: The bezels of the bracelet sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the bezels of the tiara, each one framing a different gemstone.
meanings.sent5: The bezels of the earrings were so intricate, they seemed to dance in the light.

meanings.definition: The frame around a computer or television screen.
meanings.sent1: The sleek bezels of the monitor enhanced the viewing experience.
meanings.sent2: The thin bezels of the TV screen give it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: Sarah accidentally spilled coffee on the bezels of her laptop, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: The bezels of the computer screen seemed to disappear, leaving only the display visible.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors on the screen contrasted beautifully with the black bezels.
